Notes: unattested elsewhere, except in block 3 below
A Semitic name, similar to a few found in other inscriptions by Cumont; possible its all one name transcribed differently from Hebrew to the Greek alphabet?
"scrawling" letters; possible mns was there before, but chipping obscures reading
Could be part of a name, or possible dating (like on the Gate). Uncertain
Palmyrene name; no similar names attested at Dura, although some at Palmyrene with different vowels
ς in ths and ης in aurhs are doubtful
